resource.name: Memphis Police Department: Public Safety Incidents
resource.description:
This dataset contains all crime incidents where a police report was taken. Data goes back to 2006 and is updated on a daily basis.

Terms of Use: The information in this portal is provided strictly as a courtesy to the public. This website provides information as to initial crime reports, and does not reflect subsequent changes in the investigation, nature, or accuracy of the initial report. While all attempts are made to ensure the correctness and suitability of information presented here, neither the City of Memphis nor the Memphis Police Department guarantee the accuracy of the information contained herein. Crime data may be amended or corrected by the Memphis Police Department at any time. This data may not reflect the official crime index totals as reported to the Tennessee Bureau of Investigation.
columns_description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Council Super District Boundaries Dec 2022' (scpn-qt9a) the point in column 'location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Council District Boundaries Dec 2022' (fuzm-ngj2) the point in column 'location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

resource.name: FY23 MWBE Citywide Spend by Gender/Ethnicity Report
resource.description:
This dataset shows the breakdown of City of Memphis FY21 spend with minority and women owned business enterprises (MWBEs) by gender and ethnicity.

Footnotes
1. Unallocated represents those checks that were not attributed to a division at the time of payment.
2. Retirement investment, money manager, and custodian fees are excluded from eligible spend in this report, but will be included in a separate report produced by the Finance Division and Investment Manager.
3. In the event that a business is eligible for both MBE and WBE certifications, the MBE certification is counted. However, a business may elect to maintain only a WBE certification. As a result, the Caucasian Female dollar percent will not exactly match the WBE percent.
4. Payments to subcontractors are reported by prime contractors on a monthly basis, the total of which is reflected in Column J above. In some cases, depending on the date of prime payment and the date of reported sub payment, these payments could be split across reporting periods. In rare cases, this could result in a percentage over 100% due to the denominator being captured in one report, and the numerator being captured in the following report.

resource.name: Police Academy Applicants & Recruits
resource.description: Aggregated information on the number of applicants to the Memphis Police Department's Police Academy.
columns_description: Cumulative total number of applicants, calendar year to date
Goal number of recruits at the end of the training

Type of academy class (PR=regular police recruit, PST=police service tech, etc.)
Total number of applicants for recruit class

resource.name: FY20 Minority & Women Owned Business Enterprises (MWBE) Spend Report
resource.description:
This dataset shows the breakdown of City of Memphis FY20 spend with minority and women owned business enterprises. The breakdown includes data for all divisions in addition to a citywide total.

*Unallocated represents those checks that were not attributed to a division at the time of payment.

**Public Works spent an additional $19,956,641.03 with MWBE firms through the Sewer Assessment and Rehabilitation Program, which is managed by Black and Veatch. This amount is not included in the official report because it is managed by an outside entity. However, if that amount were included, Public Works percent MWBE spend would be 24.5%.

***Retirement investment, money manager, and custodian fees are excluded from eligible spend in this report, but will be included in a separate report produced by the Finance Division and Investment Manager.

****In the event that a business is eligible for both MBE and WBE certifications, the MBE certification is counted. However, a business may elect to maintain only a WBE certification. As a result, the Caucasian Female dollar percent will not exactly match the WBE percent.
columns_name: Percent Certified + Non Certified MWBE Spend

resource.name: FY21 Minority & Women Owned Business Enterprises (MWBE) Spend Report
resource.description:
This dataset shows the breakdown of City of Memphis FY21 spend with minority and women owned business enterprises. The breakdown includes data for all divisions in addition to a citywide total..

Footnotes
1. Unallocated represents those checks that were not attributed to a division at the time of payment.																									
2. Retirement investment, money manager, and custodian fees are excluded from eligible spend in this report, but will be included in a separate report produced by the Finance Division and Investment Manager.														
3. In the event that a business is eligible for both MBE and WBE certifications, the MBE certification is counted. However, a business may elect to maintain only a WBE certification. As a result, the Caucasian Female dollar percent will not exactly match the WBE percent.														
4. Payments to subcontractors are reported by prime contractors on a monthly basis, the total of which is reflected in Column J above. In some cases, depending on the date of prime payment and the date of reported sub payment, these payments could be split across reporting periods. In rare cases, this could result in a percentage over 100% due to the denominator being captured in one report, and the numerator being captured in the following report.
columns_name: Percent Certified + Non Certified MWBE Spend

resource.name: Memphis City Employment Data
resource.description: This dataset shows employment data for the City of Memphis obtained from the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics.
resource.attribution: The Bureau of Labor Statistics of the U.S. Department of Labor website
columns_description: Total number of Memphians in the labor force - including employed and unemployed as defined by the BLS ("do not have a job, have actively looked for work in the prior 4 weeks, and are currently available for work"). More info here: https://www.bls.gov/cps/cps_htgm.htm#unemployed.
January=M01, Feb=M02, Mar=M03, etc.
Percent unemployment for the City of Memphis according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS). Learn more about how the BLS defines unemployment here: https://www.bls.gov/cps/cps_htgm.htm
Number of employed Memphians according to the BLS
Reporting month & year
Calendar year
Number of unemployed Memphians according to the BLS

domain_metadata.value: Information culled from Bureau of Labor Statistics website.

resource.name: Paving Budget
resource.description: This dataset shows the amount budgeted each year for asphalt paving in the Capital Improvement Program Budget.
columns_description: Adopted budget for street repaving, listed as "Asphalt/Paving" in the annual Capital Improvement Program budget under the Division of Public Works. Access full yearly budgets at https://www.memphistn.gov/government/finance.
Fiscal year (from July 1 the previous year to June 30th of the listed year)

resource.name: MATA On Time Performance
resource.description: This dataset shows the on-time performance of MATA, MATAPlus buses, and trolleys on a monthly basis.
columns_description: Percent of the time MATA fixed-route buses arrived on schedule for the reporting month
MATA'S goal is to achieve a 90% on-time arrival rate for MATAplus service vehicles
MATA'S goal is to achieve a 76% on-time arrival rate for fixed-route buses

Percent of the time MATAplus service vehicles arrived on schedule for the reporting month. MATAPlus is a shared ride paratransit service designed to meet the transportation needs of persons with disabilities in the Memphis area. More information available at http://www.matatransit.com/services/mataplus
Reporting month and year

resource.name: Community Neighborhoods Boundaries 2
resource.description:
This shapefile includes neighborhoods boundaries from Community Foundation, Innovate Memphis, neighborhood CDCs, and other civic groups for use on the map tools "Public Safety" and "Open311." It is not an exhaustive list. If you'd like add your group's boundaries, please contact Sarah Harris at sarah.harris@memphistn.gov.

Due to a limitation of the platform, community boundaries are split in to two groups to avoid overlapping boundaries.

resource.name: Residential & Commercial Alarms
resource.description:
This dataset shows detailed information related to the operation of the City's Metro Alarm Office, including the number of permits issued and the number of false alarms recorded each month.

Please note: From July 2017-present, the columns "False Alarms" and False Alarms Historical" are identical. Prior to the ordnance passed in June 2017, the only false alarms that could be counted were those verified and matched by MPD's reporting database. This is reflected in the "False Alarms" column, pre July 2017. In order to get a true reflection of the volume of historical false alarms, dispatched records were matched and aggregated. This is reflected in the column "False Alarms Historical," pre July 2017.
columns_description: Number of accounts that were charged for their 3rd false alarm.
Reporting month
Dollar amount collected during reporting month
Dollar amount billed during reporting month
Total dollar amount charged
Total false alarms received during the reporting month
Residential alarm permits added during the reporting month
Reporting month & year (date rounds to 1st of the month)
Month order (1=January, 12=December)
Please see dataset description for further explanation.
Commercial alarm permits added during the reporting month
Reporting year

resource.name: MDR Scorecard Open Requests
resource.description: This dataset focuses on five high volume service requests: missed pickups, potholes, cart repair, weeds, and outside bin pickup.  It shows the current number of open requests and the length of time they have been open.
columns_description: Type of request. This dataset shows 5 selected high-volume request types: missed pickups, potholes, cart repair, weeds, and outside bin waste.
Number of open requests for each request type (updated daily)
Number of requests that have been open for 0-15 days
Number of requests that have been open for 16-30 days
Number of requests that have been open for 31-45 days
Number of requests that have been open for more than 45 days

domain_metadata.value: Updated before Mayor's Dashboard Review on the last Wednesday of every month.
